title.narrative: Agreement on core support to the Sustainable Development Solutions Network III
Decision on contribution for Sustainable Development Solutions Network III

description.narrative: Examples of results achieved during 2019 in line with the four outcomes for the intervention: • Outcome 1: Successful operationalization of the Sustainable Development Goals and the international agreement to curb human-induced climate change. The Sustainable Development Report (SDR2019), released in June 2019, was presented during the High-Level Political Forum (HLPF) on July 16 at an SDSN-OECD side event. The SDR2019 was also presented on September 23rd during the UN General Assembly at a side-event. The findings of the report have been widely cited in the media. • Outcome 2: A strong Sustainable Development Solutions Network (SDSN) with National and Regional SDSNs around the world to promote solution initiatives and support the implementation of the SDGs. The SDSN Leadership Council met in September 2019, alongside the UN General Assembly. SDSN networks continue to grow in number; SDSN currently has 33 Networks. At the same time, their individual capacities and portfolios are growing as well. SDSN expect several additional networks to be launched over the next year. During the reporting period, the SDSN has also launched a new solution initiative on target-setting for the biodiversity COP in 2020 in China. The Nature Map initiative is co-led with International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA) and the UNEP-World Conservation Monitoring Center (UNEP-WCMC). • Outcome 3: Adoption of novel Solution Initiatives, including long-term pathways for transformations to sustainable development. SDSN's existing solution initiatives are proceeding as planned.The first report by the The Food, Agriculture, Biodiversity, Land-Use, and Energy (FABLE) Consortium was released in July. It presents preliminary pathways towards sustainable land-use and food systems prepared by 18 country teams from developed and developing countries, including the European Union. The report represents the first coordinated effort by researchers from most G20 countries and other nations to chart long-term pathways towards sustainable land-use and food systems. • Outcome 4: World-class Education on Sustainable Development for Everyone. During the reporting period SDSN reached 126,914 enrollments, leading to total cumulative enrolments since the SDG Academy began to nearly 280,000 learners.The reporting period saw the launch of the spring cohort of the University Partnership Program, including 4 new partners, and the fall cohort of 20 universities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
